result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chantel Storm Saddler

records.addlTxt:
OFF THE RECORD / 2:45 PM Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler in court by video.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Chantel Storm Saddler.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attny Novack makes statement as to DEF status on treatment.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

BOND AMENDED TO SIGNATURE BOND -  JULY 11, 2022 @ 8:15 AM.    DEF to travel to Bizhiiki Center and then Arbor Place in Menomonie, WI.    Following the 28 days Arbor Place Program, DEF is authorized to reside at Ain Dah Ing Halfway House in Cameron, WI for a period of 90 days.  

If DEF leaves Arbor Place or Ain Dah Ing for any reason than authorized, the court will issue an arrest warrant and bail will revert to cash bond.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
ORDER TO MODIFY BOND
Defense motion to modify bond for temporary release
Proposed order allowing temporary release for treatment

2:45 PM Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler appeared by video, in custody in Barron County.   Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video for Chantel Storm Saddler. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   
Attny Novack indicates DEF has obtained a bed for treatment, working on arrangements.  Statement indicates in agreement and request bond modifications.   Court modifies bond, requests Attny Novack to file proposed order for bond modifications.
Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:39 AM Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack appeared by video.   Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.
Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Document # 18 removed as it contained the wrong information, etc.
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.

12:11PM Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail, with Attorney Gregg H. Novack appearing by video. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (22CF78, 21CF331) and recites appearances. Atty Novack makes statement, no agreement, has filed bail modification motion.  Court reviews motion.  State makes a statement on bond modification, opposes, requests additional information on modification / treatment plan.  Atty Novack makes statement on bond / treatment plan, pend modification for additional treatment details.  Court denies motion at this time, parties can re-address with additional treatment details included.  State indicates prelim needed in 21CF331.  Atty Novack indicates prelim held in 22CF78 on 3/25/22.  Court indicates 21CF331 needs Information, 22CF78 has Information filed.  State requests prelim for 21CF331 be set.  Atty Novack agrees, requests prelim within 14 days.  Court sets prelim in 21CF331 and STC for 22CF78 for 5/23/22 at 9:30AM.  Court indicates bond / treatment plan can be re-addressed at that time.
Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defense bail motion
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

OFF THE REOCRD;  01:26 PM Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler not in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack.  Kenneth Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attny Novack request adjournment, working on resolution.  Court reset.  Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:55 AM Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack appears by zoom.  Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by zoom for the State of Wisconsin.    DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty Novack acknowledged receipt of information and waives reading.  DEF entered NG plea to all counts.

Attny  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.

11:30 AM Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler in court with attorney Gregg H. Novack appears by zoom.  Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by zoom for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.   11:31 am  OFF THE RECORD:  Attny Novack and DEF enter break out room for discussion.   11:45 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD;  State calls witness City of Hayward Officer Dillon Saraniecki,  State request Court to take Judicial Notice Bond dated 12/21/2022 in Sawyer County Case 21CF331 ,  Attny Novack no objection. Court takes judicial notice.   Court sworn in witness.  State begins examination. 11:47 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.   11:48 AM  Attny Novack  objection - location-  Witness vertified location.  State continued examination.  11:50 am Attny Novack objection - leading - State rephrase.  State continues.  Attny Novack objection again - leading -  Court order state rephrase question.  State continues examination.  11:52 am  Cross examination by Attny Novack.  11:55 am  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Novack makes argument and request dismissal.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

Attny Novack filed bond motion.   Court reviews motion.  State objects to bond motion.   Court denies bond motion.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

8:41AM Defendant Chantel Storm Saddler in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Gregg H. Novack, appearing by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Novack indicates he has not received criminal complaint, case recently filed.  DEF has rec'd copy of criminal complaint today, verified name, address, and DOB.  Atty Novack request prelim within time limits.  Court sets prelim for 3/25/22 at 11:0AM.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Ness argues bond.  Court sets bond.  Court sets initial appearance for 3/15/22  at 8:30AM.
